that's it. Or there's a rattle in Israel, you know, to react that way. Yeah. And there was some crazy
overreaction fairly recently. I saw somebody post something on Facebook about
why like it was the title of the post was essentially like, why Donald Trump is not the
beast there, you know, and it was wounded in the head. And that's it right there, baby. But and
like what he said was this, why this is not and the vitriol that kind of just came in the comments.
I was like, Whoa. Yes, it was, it was like, it was crazy. And so I was like, I don't know. Yeah,
it is a I would love to really encourage, like, please, Christians out there when we see something
that we want to react with fear, or with immediate persecution response or whatever.
It isn't that we may be right or wrong about some of these things when new research comes out.
And we go, Oh, now again, this is a human thing. When research comes out that says, Hey,
you know, there may be a genetic predisposition for attraction. Don't overreact. Listen,
that's part of our tenants of Christianity is that all of us are born sinful. And somehow that's not
the one magic sin no one could be born with a predisposition for welcome to the human race.
But if you're going to do that, you know, if you're going to immediately react, then
when like the cast review just came out saying, it turns out that maybe transgender treatment,
affirming treatments to children actually do more harm than good almost universally. Well, then
why are we suddenly a big fan of that? It was like, Oh, it turns out, almost all humans like
research that backs what they already believe. And we try to throw out the relationship that
the any type of research that doesn't back what we already believe. And how cool if Christians
were the ones who are able to do that well to go, Oh, I need to, I'm going to have to think about
this. So which I think will make us so much more winsome to culture. So I think what I'm
like hearing from all of our conversation is like, first of all, take a breath. Like you don't have to
immediately respond. Yes, please. Like just maybe sit for a minute. Yeah. And then also, yeah,
just like, regardless of what it is, respond in the way of Jesus, because responding lovingly
is not compromised. Like responding with kindness or hearing someone's side or hearing like other
opinions that you disagree with is like not the same as compromising truth. And, and on the
contrary, when you are having those conversations, we'll make it where you can be heard more clearly.
Yes. So anything else I would add, please take your time, be humble and listen. And I make sure
you understand what people are coming from. And then, then craft a response that would be
thoughtful, indicate a certain level of preparation and intelligence and sophistication. Again,
we don't compromise. We're allowed to take stands and hold to them, but we want that to be done
humbly and intelligently. Come let us reason together. And I think that's where we want to
come at this. So this is good. It's, this has been therapeutic for me, if nothing else, to be able to
unpack some of these. Thank you for finding them. Our bill Halloween ones and the, that's pretty good.
Those are some good stuff. And by the way, we do have other material. We've talked about some of
these on other podcasts. Totally. Look those, if you're like, what, but what about Halloween? I didn't
say enough. Like it's, and by the way, you probably didn't say it that way. That's me doing my Christian
response voice again. Sorry. Look it up and check it out. And we'd love to follow up on any of that.
We'll, we'll happily talk about any of these things more. So thanks guys. I love it.
Thank you for joining us for this episode of Reconstructed Faith.
If you enjoyed what you heard or were challenged, please leave us a review.
It'll help other people find us. If you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed,
shoot me an email at info at southspring.org. Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South
Spring Baptist church. Remember, don't give up. Trust God. Search for answers.
